intro: Justicia peploides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its vibrant red or orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its striking appearance and adaptability to various garden conditions.
